phoenix.impl

Class MediaMetadataAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • phoenix.impl.MediaMetadataAPI

  • public class MediaMetadataAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    Service Calls for Dealing with media file metadata. ie, for searching for metadata, updating metadata and enabling/disabling metadata providers.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • StartMetadataScan

        public java.lang.Object StartMetadataScan(java.lang.Object source,
                                          java.lang.Object options)
        Starts the Metadata/Fanart Scanner will an array of MediaFile objects.

        If a scan is in progress, then this scan is immediately aborted, and this scan will not happen.

        The Scanner will start a separate thread for the scan and return immediately

        TODO: Figure out a way to have the scanner notify on complete

        Parameters:
        mediaFiles - Object Array of Sage MediaFile or Airing objects, or a File object specifying a directory
        options - IMetadataOptions instance
        Returns:
        ProgressTracker instance for the current scan, or null, if a scan could not be started

      • IsMetadataScanRunning

        public boolean IsMetadataScanRunning(java.lang.Object progress)
        Returns true if a metadata scan is currently in progress.
        Parameters:
        progress - ProgressTracker from a StartMetadataScan operation
        Returns:
        true if scan in progress

      • GetMetadataScanComplete

        public float GetMetadataScanComplete(java.lang.Object tracker)
        Returns the percent complete in the scan. 0 mean not started, 1 means completed.
        Parameters:
        tracker - Progress Tracker from a StartMetadataScan operation
        Returns:
        float value representing the percent complete of the current scan

      • CancelMetadataScan

        Cancel a scan
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • GetMetadataSearchResultScore

        public float GetMetadataSearchResultScore(IMetadataSearchResult result)
        Get the score for the given metadata search result. A scor is a float value from 0-1 indicating the strength of the search resule in relation to the original title, file. A value is stronger as it appoaches 1.
        Parameters:
        result - metadata search result
        Returns:
        float score

      • GetMetadataSearchResultYear

        public java.lang.String GetMetadataSearchResultYear(IMetadataSearchResult result)
        Get the Year for the given metadata search result.
        Parameters:
        result - metadata search result
        Returns:
        year

      • GetMetadataSearchResultProviderId

        public java.lang.String GetMetadataSearchResultProviderId(IMetadataSearchResult result)
        get the provider id that was used to return the given result. A provider id basically identifies which provider actually performed the search, ie, imdb, dvd profiler, tvdb, etc.
        Parameters:
        result - metadata search result
        Returns:
        provider id

      • GetMetadataSearchResults

        public IMetadataSearchResult[] GetMetadataSearchResults(java.lang.Object mediaFile,
                                                        java.lang.String name,
                                                        java.lang.String type)
        Used to find metadata for a media file using a specified name and type. ie, it will ignore the name and type of the mediaFile and search using the passed name and time
        Parameters:
        mediaFile - Sage MediaFile object
        name - Show Title, Movie Title, etc
        type - TV, Movie, Music
        Returns:
        search results or null if no results.

      • UpdateMediaFileMetadata

        public void UpdateMediaFileMetadata(java.lang.Object mediaFile,
                                    IMetadataSearchResult result)
        udpate the metadata for the given media file with the specified search result. This will download all fanart and update the sage properties associated with the mediafile object.

        if wait is true, then this call will block until the metadata has been updated. If false, then it will run the background, and it will notify the user of errors using the SystemMessage event service.

        Parameters:
        mediaFile - SageTV media file object
        result - metadata search result
        wait - if false, then it will run in the background

      • UpdateMediaFileMetadata

        public void UpdateMediaFileMetadata(java.lang.Object mediaFile,
                                    IMetadataSearchResult result,
                                    boolean wait,
                                    java.lang.Object options)
        udpate the metadata for the given media file with the specified search result. This will download all fanart and update the sage properties associated with the mediafile object.

        if wait is true, then this call will block until the metadata has been updated. If false, then it will run the background, and it will notify the user of errors using the SystemMessage event service.

        The valid options are overwrite-fanart, overwrite-metadata. All options must be set as a string such as "true" or "false"

        Parameters:
        mediaFile - SageTV media file object
        result - metadata search result
        wait - if false, then it will run in the background
        options - a Map of options
